title: Man filmed punching his dog as it sat quietly on a chair
text:
Warning: Upsetting content

Kieran Huelin hits and shouts at his pet dog Rosie (Picture: Triangle News)

This shocking video shows a man punching his pet dog during a torrent of abuse.

Kieran Huelin, 36, can be seen hitting and shouting at his dog Rosie, who then cowers on a chair at the home in Bolton.

The RSPCA were called to investigate after they were sent this video showing Huelin attacking his Staffordshire bull terrier.

He has now been banned from keeping dogs for five years by magistrates and given a 12-month community order.

Inspector Danni Jennings was sent to investigate at Huelin’s flat on June 14.

The RSPCA were also provided with some details of where the incident is said to have taken place.

Inspector Jennings recognised Huelin who lived at the flat as the man in the video, which is too shocking to show in full.

Bolton magistrates’ court heard that Huelin signed Rosie over into RSPCA care while an investigation took place.

Rosie is now in the care of the RSPCA (Picture: Triangle News)

Inspector Jennings said: ‘Dog owners should always make sure their pets are handled properly and not stressed or endangered with any aggressive or anti-social behaviour.

‘Training should always be reward-based and should not include physical punishment as this may cause pain, suffering and distress.

‘Rosie is a lovely and bouncy dog in real life but on this footage she is quite the opposite.’

Huelin admitted one count under the Animal Welfare Act when he appeared at court.

As well as the ban and community order, he was ordered to pay £800 costs and a £85 victim surcharge.

He was also given an alcohol treatment order.
